title: Thunderbird üzerinden şirket hesabına erişim sağlayamıyoruz.
content:
Merhaba,

uygulama sekmesini açtığımız da şifre ile giriş yapmamızı istemektedir. Şifre ile giriş yapıldığı zaman bağlantı sağlanamadı hatası ile karşılaşmaktayız. Hata görselini ekte tarafınıza iletimini sağlamış bulunmaktayız. Bu konu ile ilgili teknik desteğinizi talep etmekteyiz.

İyi çalışmalar dileriz.

title: email signature
content:
Hi there, When sending an email I have set up (in account settings) that an outgoing email has a 'signature image from a file'.

When I open a new message to send, the signature file (image) is there at the bottom of the email. I can double click that image and I get an 'edit image properties' box - so I can change the size of image and add a link to that image.

The problem is that I have to make those changes to each e-mail I send. Is there a way to set the default parameters of that signature image (size, add link etc..)

Many thanks in advance Regards Michael

title: All address books wiped empty by update
content:
Thunderbird decided to update on it's own. The end result is that all all address books (of which I had about a dozen of) are empty. I went to check the appdata roaming thunderbird profiles -folder as suggested by a few others having similar issues. There are 40+ abook.mab.bak files of different numbers, each with a *.bak copy next to it. The baks are 4kB, the mab files are 320kB and needless to say, none of them contain any of the address books. Same with history files. There are no larger files to be found anywhere in that folder.

Does this mean Thunderbird decided to destroy over a decade's worth of work just to update the stupid software? *that* folder was not backed up. It also seems there are no previous versions of that file available, as usual with Windows. :/

title: Thunderbird 112.0b1 beta - Lost menus changes after upgrading to 112.0b1 Beta
content:
Please disregard below - I have joined the TB Beta group discussion and found this link regarding my issue, but I have yet to figure out how to make the like changes which user HS6666 was able to perform. I welcome anyone that can share this steps. https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/beta/Tc91f881568f3af8e/large-empty-area-at-the-top


I may have been 2 patches down level. 3/16/2023 last night around 7pm (EST) Thunderbird Beta was acting very strange, I rebooted my PC but didn't start Thunderbird until this morning 3/17/2023. I quickly noticed the UI looked completed different - my custom menu (not sure correct name) was no longer present. See attachment where I did attempt to customize the Toolbar, also notice the search bar is at same bar, I don't recall ever have a prior "search" area, I would using use the (edit>find>search messages). I attempted to recreate them (Print, Mark, Get Message), but I don't recall each custom change I made prior. The new UI looks WAY different - I'm not pleased that I have to relearn everything, I read on "Changes" for 112.0b1 that some fixes for Various Unified Toolbar improvements and Various visual and UX improvements were "Fixed" but I without reading each note to figure out what I need to do to get the UI close to what it looked like before - I am posting this issue with hopes others can advise me and if they too have had this issue. Thanks in advance - Jim - How do I get them back as before?
creator: blueiceking

title: Lost inbox profile in Windows 11
content: My wife and I have been using Thunderbird for many years through various incarnations of Windows. We upgraded recently to Windows 11 and are running v.102 of Thunderbird. When my wife tried to open her inbox this morning there was a continual buffer eventually disclosing an empty panel except for a column of stars all down the left side. Buffer is still running afte some hours. I checked the properties of her inbox. Folder location line is blank. Number of messages unknown. I can identify the folder as it is identical to mine except for one digit but I am unable to paste or type this location into the blank line. So, I can't repair the folder. Her sent folder is fine and all my folders working perfectly. Any idea how I can get Thunderbird to recognise her inbox, please?

title: Filter behavior with Gmai/IMAP

When I try to delete the ST copy in inbox it just removes the ST and the message remains. The left click menu delete works. None of these actions have any effect on the moved message. Messages are moved to Local Folders. When I select an unread message in the inbox it immediately changes to ST status. No messages have ST in Allmail. I tried to set the delete action to move messages to a "New trash" folder and most of the inbox vanished. The "Inbox" appears to be worthless and undependable. title: Can't Change Designation from Junk to Not Junk
content:
This week, for some reason, Thunderbird decided that emails from a specific email address are trash. I've been getting these emails for years with no problem. When I mark it as not junk, it goes to the inbox temporarily and then back to trash.

I set up a message filter to move them to inbox, but the same thing happened. So, I set up a message filter to move the messages to inbox after being marked as junk. No luck.

As a non-techie, it looks like somewhere inside Thunderbird I have to manually change the designation for that email address. How do I do that? If I'm wrong, very possible, what do I do?

I am using a 2017 MacBook Air using version 12.6.3.

Abra

title: Unable to sync Thunderbird with Outlook.com using POP
content:
My wife and I have been using Thunderbird for many, many years and have never had a problem, even when migrating from one computer to another. A few weeks ago she became unable to connect and sync her email. The error message is:

"Sending of password for user xxxxxx@hotmail.com did not succeed. Mail server pop3.live.com responded Connection is closed 12."

She can get to her emails by going directly to outlook.com and using her email address and password. I have been through each setting in her Thunderbird profile and, since I have no problems, even compared it to the settings in my profile. We both have our own laptops, so that is a factor. I also tried disabling her antivirus software temporarily to see if that was interfering. As a last ditch effort, I backed up her emails and then deleted her email account in Thunderbird and re-created it. The same problem existed. She has a relatively new Lenovo laptop running Windows 10. Does anyone have any ideas or thoughts?

Thank you! JF

creator: rene771

title: Cannot import calendar from Thunderbird to other installation
content:
I exported three of my calendars from Thunderbird (102.9.0) in .ics format, then opened them on a different computer (same version, just installed).

One of them, the simplest one, which only has recurring whole-day events (I use it for birthdays) imported correctly. The other two both give me the error: "Cannot import from etcetc.ics. There are no importable items in this file".

Opening them in notepad, all three have the following header in common:

BEGIN:VCALENDAR PRODID:-//Mozilla.org/NONSGML Mozilla Calendar V1.1//EN VERSION:2.0

But then, where the birthdays calendar has the events (BEGIN: VEVENT ...) right away, the other two instead have some extra information like:

BEGIN:VCALENDAR PRODID:-//Mozilla.org/NONSGML Mozilla Calendar V1.1//EN VERSION:2.0 BEGIN:VTIMEZONE TZID:Europe/Berlin BEGIN:DAYLIGHT TZOFFSETFROM:+0100 TZOFFSETTO:+0200 TZNAME:CEST DTSTART:19700329T020000 RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY;BYMONTH=3;BYDAY=-1SU END:DAYLIGHT BEGIN:STANDARD TZOFFSETFROM:+0200 TZOFFSETTO:+0100 TZNAME:CET DTSTART:19701025T030000 RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY;BYMONTH=10;BYDAY=-1SU END:STANDARD END:VTIMEZONE

After that, they too have events as expected, so I don't understand why Thunderbird can't import them.

I tried removing these extra lines but nothing changed.

There's quite a lot of history in these calendars and many future events I don't want to either lose or transcribe manually. What can I do to import them properly?
creator: itashadd

creator: billcanwork

title: Thunderbird email files have same modification date and time
content: My wife and I are both using Thunderbird 102.9 on Windows 10, with the emails stored in "maildir" format. (One file per message.) Last night when I was backing up the Thunderbird profile folder on her laptop to another drive, I noticed that a huge number of files had been modified, and they mostly had the same modification date and time (give or take a few minutes.) (I use FreeFileSync to copy the changed files to the other drive, but that's probably not significant.) After a day's usage, I would expect a couple of hundred megabytes of data to need copying, but in this case, it was well over a gigabyte. The files that were being updated ranged from a few days older to a year or two older than the files which were being copied over them. Running her Thunderbird installation today, all seems normal; the email "received" and "date" times seem normal, and it looks like the emails themselves aren't corrupted. I'm wondering if there's any function within Thunderbird which would cause these file dates to be modified en masse in this way? (Or perhaps it's a Windows 10 thing... but as far as I know, no file date modification utilities were in use, nor is there any malware on our systems. (I think Malwarebytes Pro would be throwing up warnings all over the place if this was the case, and we scan daily.) Any suggestions would be gratefully received. Kind regards, Roger V.
creator: rogerval

title: Thunderbird read emails
